page.title: 01North Runcton and Middleton.
page.content: The area contains the villages of North Runcton and Middleton about three miles south-East of Kings Lynn.They stand on a ridge running West to East with marshy land to the North and South. { Farming}is the main economic activity and the villages were once mainly agricultural communities. Now only a small proportion of the villagers work on the land and most commute to Kings Lynn to work. The older buidings in the villages are often built of{carstone,}the local brown sandstone. In the last thirty years there has been much new building in brick, often bungalows. The{A47}trunk road runs along the ridge and passes through Middleton. { Population}in 1981 (1961 in brackets) was:- Middleton 1178 (976) North Runcton 540 (383).
